Description of incident: A customer logged onto her USPS online store account and was able to see the name, address, and the final four digits of another customer's credit card number.  The customer alerted the USPS customer service, but was told that the error had already been noted. On October 28, USPS became aware that a coding issue during an update had resulted in an error that exposed credit card information.  Customers were notified of the problem on November 8.  The error was subsequently fixed.
